result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Rebecca OClaire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Defendant is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Courts Office, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Clerk of Circuit Court Ashland County
201 West Main Street, Room 307
Ashland,WI  54806
The cash bond posted with the Clerk of Court Office on behalf of the Defendant applied towards the financial obligations( Rec 14R 003181)

The Defendant, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under Wisconsin statutes Sect. 941.29 under the Wisconsin Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under Wisconsin State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances(MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores,(any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol), any place where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Defendant is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Defendant.
  The Defendant is to provide a DNA specimen.
  The Defendant is to take all his/her prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physician and all prescribed medication(s) taken only as prescribed!
The Defendant is subject to random UA testing
The Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and follow all recommended treatment
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
